intro: Psychilis olivacea, commonly known as the olive-leaved psychilis, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small evergreen shrub characterized by its lance-shaped, leathery leaves that are typically olive-green in color. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by small, fleshy berries. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native habitat.
